name: Del Marcos Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Del Marcos for 4 nights to attend a conference at the Convention Center. The atmosphere is so relaxing, accomodations very clean and comfortable, and the staff very accomodating and available.
reviews.title: Sweet Spot of Palm Springs
Nice architecture, nice atmosphere
reviews.text: This hotel is only a block away from the busy streets filled with shopping, food and drink. The grounds are spotless and the continental breakfast was enjoyable around the pool.
Definitely will be a place I will return.
reviews.title: You are now entering 1947!

reviews.text: I stayed with my son 5 nights in the Ocean Eleven room. Our stay was very comfortable, and the room was excellent, as it is actually two rooms, one a smaller, very cozy one, and one a bigger one with ample space for hanging out, amidst the theme of the "rat pack", which is a nice touch. The room also has a kitchen. There is a nice view of a mountain side on the balcony. Hotel staff was friendly and efficient, and the continental breakfast was very good. The hotel was built in 1947, and the architecture is lovely (as is that of many buildings in Palm Springs!). I would not hesitate to come back to this hotel on my next visit to Palm Springs.
reviews.title: Del Marcos in Palm Springs - EXCELLENT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here last month for two nights. The staff is awesome! Fruit and continental breakfast and citrus water on site is also awesome! We did get to take advantage of the lovely pool and firepit. Only one thing could be different for the better, a hot tub :)
reviews.title: A beautiful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, tiny Chihuahua and I spent 3 nights at the Del Marcos Hotel in early March and knew already from their website we would be in for a treat. This hotel is a delight to look at and an even bigger delight to stay in. From the beautiful and lovingly selected decor to the delicious saltwater heated pool. The service was generally excellent and the room in which we stayed could not have been cleaner. You are in an amazing location with the downtown area just one block away, but you won't know that when you are lounging by the pool or playing shuffleboard or sitting in the adorable lobby area. It is calm and peaceful, with just a hint of Rat Pack music in the background that supplies the perfect soundtrack for your stay.
reviews.title: Rat Pack Heaven in Palm Springs

reviews.text: I just stopped by chance at this hotel looking for a room for a one night stay. The hotel is very nice, with a nice pool, and conveniently located near downtown. The room was very comfortable and nicely furnished. The staff was very friendly, attentive, and helpful. The breakfast included in the rate is a convenient plus.
reviews.title: Very nice and confortable place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Del Marcos was a friendly and wonderful place to stay. The staff were lovely and I will be planning another trip for next year and staying there. It was handy to everything and we could walk to dinner at night and had a choice of places to eat.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: The breakfast at Del Marcos was lovely and I enjoyed sitting by the pool each morning. The place had such a great feel to it and everyone was so friendly.
reviews.title: A retro paradise.

reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the del Marcos for modernism week. Great location, friendly staff, and a relaxing and centrally located atmosphere. Highly recommend. We loved that it was adults only, there was lounge music by the pool and the laid back but attentive staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price

reviews.text: This property has roots back to 1947 and it tries to stay true to those roots. It is VERY close to downtown and walking distance to great places to eat and gather. My suite was spacious, clean, and bare essentials equipped. The TV is new and cable worked well. The wifi was fast and easy which is very appreciated. The floors are painted concrete - first ever for me in a hotel I am paying a lot of money for. Service is friendly but pretty slow. I tried to call three times the day before my stay to confirm and got an answering machine every time - no one returned any of my calls. The day I checked in there was no one at the desk to great me - had to wait for her to walk up and finish her phone call before I got checked in. A good experience for sure, but if you have to pay over $200 per night, consider other options.
reviews.title: Quaint property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A small hotel with a great mid-century feel throughout. Check-in was a breeze - a nice welcome drink included. We had a large upstairs room with private sun deck - loved it! The location was convenient to downtown for shopping and eating - we walked and borrowed the fun cruiser bikes. The pool was nice and warm, plenty of lounge chairs. They have outdoor televisions by the firepit and we watched a movie one evening.
reviews.title: Perfect Palm Springs Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Del Marcos was a fabulous place to stay. Low key, immaculately clean and full of character. The location is perfect for hitting all the downtown restaurants and shopping. The views are beautiful and the staff warm and helpful. A+
reviews.title: Just fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a small quaint hotel located just a block off the main drag.
reviews.title: Great mid century modern hotel

reviews.text: The decoration, paintings and decor is from 1947 when the hotel was built.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Palm Springs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had a relaxing, fun stay...very clean and convenient...hotel staffers all were friendly and helpful...swimming pool and bicycles were huge pluses...hard to imagine how we could have enjoyed our weekend there any more than we did, even with the rainy weather.
reviews.title: Fun, Relaxing Weekend, Tough to Beat!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a family reunion. It was my first visit and lived up to all my family who had stayed before told me about.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable, with good beds and great heaters. The kitchen is a nice touch for heating up food and having nibbles. The staff is attentive and on site when needed.
reviews.title: A Refreshing Escape Back in Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool side is a delight. Floating in the pool on the rafts provided was Heaven on Earth, looking up at a bright blue sky with palm trees and the warmth of the sun was just what I needed. The music from the 40's was delightful.
reviews.title: Wonderful mid-century experience in Palm Springs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night we sat by the fire with a glass of wine and enjoyed each others company. We even watched a football game on the outdoor TV. SO Great!
reviews.title: First rate really tasteful hotel

description: EXCITING NEWS!! September 2013We've just reopened after a month of upgrades/renovations! New terrazzo bathroom floors in every room, two rooms floors have been completely terrazzo'd, we've added another full kitchen, expanded space in several rooms, added a room with two beds and accomplished many other needed repairs. Updated photos will be added to the site as soon as possible.One of the most photographed buildings in Palm Springs, designed in 1947 by iconic architect William F. Cody, the backdrop of this classic Mid-Century 17 room hotel, is the stunning San Jacinto Mountains. Enjoy the scenic biking or hiking trails or simply relax around the serene saltwater pool listening to the sounds of the Forties. From our comfortable well appointed Standard rooms to our large Deluxe Suites, the hotel offers guest rooms furnished with a Mid-Century Flair. Private patios, balconies, kitchenettes and full kitchens are available. Located only 1 block from downtown. "Once you arrive there's no need to drive." Complimentary Palm Springs Art Museum Passes and Discounted Tram Tickets are available.Complimentary Cruiser Bike use, Continental Breakfast, WiFi and Parking with no Resort Fees!
